meanings.definition: A yellowish, waxy substance secreted in the ear canal.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used a special tool to examine the cerumen in the patient's ear.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to insert anything into your ear to avoid pushing the cerumen deeper.
meanings.sent3: The cerumen in his ear looked like a tiny candle waiting to be lit.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was muffled, as if she had cerumen blocking her ears from hearing clearly.
meanings.sent5: The cerumen resembled a protective shield, keeping the ear safe from harm.

meanings.definition: To remove cerumen from the ear canal.
meanings.sent1: The nurse will cerumen the patient's ears to improve hearing.
meanings.sent2: Remember to cerumen gently to avoid causing any damage to the ear canal.
meanings.sent3: He tried to cerumen his ears quickly, but ended up making a mess instead.
meanings.sent4: She cerumened her ears with precision, like a skilled craftsman at work.
meanings.sent5: Cerumening the ear canal felt like uncovering a hidden treasure of sound.
